page.title: 20HAWLEY - GRAVEL PITS
page.content: In the Hawley area a sand and gravel contractor excavates aggregate which is sorted and sold locally. The firm has been established for about 60 years. As each excavation is completed the hole is filled in with rubble and refuse and eventually covered with top soil, before being returned to agricultural use. This process is interesting, especially for the conservationists. S.A.G.A. have given awards for such schemes. The minerals for concrete production are available under the fields - they are needed for the building industry. Understanding between farmers and gravel workers has led to the speedy return of agricultural land once the gravel has been extracted. In Hawley an excellent example of this operation can be seen.
